intro: Calluna vulgaris f. multiplex, commonly known as the shrub rose or heather, is a compact, evergreen shrub characterized by its dense clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. It is native to the northern regions of Europe and thrives in acidic, well-drained soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and is known for its ability to form dense thickets. Its foliage consists of narrow, leathery leaves that remain green throughout the year. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and its ability to create a vibrant, colorful display in gardens and natural landscapes.
